summary: This document is an email chain between prison officials at FCI Fairton, NJ and MCC New York, discussing the coordination of Temporary Duty (TDY) assignments of staff from Fairton to assist MCC New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It involves planning travel, lodging, and scheduling for correctional officers and other staff.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The sender from MCC New York coordinating the TDY move of staff from FCI Fairton to assist their facility, requesting specific travel information.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Mentioned as being involved in coordinating the TDY move and is leaving for a week, requiring urgent setup.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Tied up with the After Action Team; the Associate Warden at FCI Fairton will email the Captain with volunteer staff information for dissemination.

persons.name: Associate Warden FCI Fairton
persons.context: The sender from FCI Fairton, NJ, providing a list of staff volunteers to go TDY at MCC New York and coordinating the scheduling.

connections.description: Working together to coordinate the TDY move of staff to MCC New York.
The Associate Warden will email the Captain with volunteer staff information for coordination.
Exchanging emails to coordinate staff TDY assignments between the two prison facilities.

events.title: Coordination of TDY Staff to MCC New York
events.description: Email correspondence planning the Temporary Duty assignment of staff from FCI Fairton to MCC New York to assist under trying circumstances, following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: MCC New York, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating immediate operational responses.
Staff from FCI Fairton, NJ are volunteering for Temporary Duty (TDY) assignments to assist MCC New York under 'very trying circumstances,' directly referencing the fallout from Epstein's death.
Planning involves groups of correctional officers (COs), non-custody staff, and lieutenants traveling for one-week or one-pay-period assignments.
The coordination highlights logistical challenges, including hotel arrangements and travel expense calculations, managed by administrative lieutenants and captains.
The email chain demonstrates inter-facility cooperation within the Bureau of Prisons to address staffing needs following a major incident.
